data.text:
In this collection of 1,055 short points for personal reflection and mental prayer, St. Josemaria Escriva provides practical advice for finding paths to holiness in the ordinary circumstances of everyday life. The points are categorized by topic and there is also a subject index.

St. Josemaria Escriva was born in Spain in 1902 and was ordained a priest in 1926. In 1928, he received the divine inspiration to found Opus Dei, a Catholic organization of lay people and priests who try to grow close to God through their ordinary lives. St. Josemaria died in 1975 and was canonized by Pope John Paul II in 2002. His liturgical feast day is June 26th.
